comments:
This happened on Linux with 20011218. It happened some time in the middle of
work when I tried to open a file. No other files were open at that time.
It looks like it tries to hide an editor part that doesn't exist any more.
I failed to reproduce this bug again.

Not sure if this bug should go to eclipse.ui or jdt.ui.

moving to platform-ui. The workbook is managed by org.eclipse.ui

additional info:
Had to restart eclipse to get rid of this problem. I don't know if
closing the perspective would have fixed it too.

From the code, it looks like the only way this could occur is if either the old 
visible editor or the new one had a null control.
Agree with Claude's assessment that it looks like it's talking to a disposed 
editor.  This should be taken care of in EditorWorkbook.remove(LayoutPart).
Please verify if this could still be an issue.
I didn't manage to reproduce it again since I reported the bug.
oops, I guess the last request from Nick was addressed to Eduardo :)
A null check has already been added to EditorWorkbook.
